movie_title: The psychology of greed ⏲️ 6 Minute English
introduction: Greed - the desire to accumulate ‘stuff’ for yourself. Neil and Beth discuss this and teach you some

vocabulary.definition: intense and selfish desire for something, especially wealth, power, or food
vocabulary.example: His greed for money led him to make unethical decisions.

vocabulary.definition: to gradually get more and more of something over a period of time
vocabulary.example: She tends to accumulate clutter in her room without realizing it.

vocabulary.definition: not awake or aware of something
vocabulary.example: He acted unconsciously, not realizing the impact of his words.

vocabulary.definition: in a way that cannot be avoided
vocabulary.example: With his reckless behavior, failure was inevitably going to happen.

vocabulary.definition: a special right, advantage, or immunity granted or available only to a particular person or group
vocabulary.example: Having access to quality education is a privilege not everyone enjoys.

vocabulary.definition: the ability to understand and share the feelings of another
vocabulary.example: She showed great empathy towards the homeless man, offering him food and shelter.
